definition: Sun Wu, also known as Sun Tzu 孫子|孙子[Sun1 zi3] (c. 500 BC, dates of birth and death uncertain), general, strategist and philosopher of the Spring and Autumn Period (700-475 BC), believed to be the author of the “Art of War” 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
grandson/descendant
surname Sun
martial/military
surname Wu

Sun Wu, famous general, strategist and Legalist philosopher, contemporary with Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC), author of "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3]/also known as Sun Tzu 孫子|孙子[Sun1 zi3]

sentences.english: In spite of this, Sun Wu explained to them in great detail how to march in the four directions.
sentences.chinese: 但是，孫武還是把這些詳詳細細地向她們解釋了一遍。

sentences.english: Then the king called in one hundred and eighty maids of honor and ordered Sun Wu to train them.
sentences.chinese: 於是吳王召來一百八十名宮女，命令孫武來訓練她們。

sentences.english: He later introduced Changsha's rich tourism resources to Sun Wu.
sentences.chinese: 張劍飛向孫武介紹了長沙的一系列旅遊資源。

sentences.english: In this limited space, Sun Wu expounds his wide-ranging views on war.
sentences.chinese: 在這不長的篇幅中，孫武全面論述了對戰爭的看法。
